name: Play It!
body:
![](https://raw.githubusercontent.com/objetos15162/Play-It-/master/Proyecto/images/portada.png)

Credits:
 - Universidad Autónoma de San Luis Potosí / Área de Computación e Informática
 - Programación Orientada a Objetos
 - 20.may.2016
 - Authors: 
     - Lilia E. Castellanos Herrero @LiliaCH
     - Esaú Balderas Zavala @EsauBz

Main Purpose:
You will be able to direct a classical music ensemble. It may be a duet, a trio or a quartet. As the conductor, you will get the opportunity of choosing which ensemble you want to conduct;

* Duet / Beethoven's Spring Sonata for piano and violin, 1st Movement excerpt.
* Trio / Beethoven's Trio de l'Archiduc for piano, violin and cello, 2nd Movement excerpt.
* Quartet / Mozart's Dissonance Quartet for violins, viola and cello, 2nd Movement excerpt.

The game is easy, you must place your hands in the designated space for each instrument depending on which ensemble you choose (you may find out more in the "How To" section in the game) upon the arrival of the instructions

![Where to place your hands if you choose to conduct the Trio](https://raw.githubusercontent.com/objetos15162/Play-It-/master/Proyecto/images/ayuda_cartelestrio.png)

![See the yellow squares? Those tell you when to tell the instruments to play. The G clefs on the right bottom corner tell you how many chances you have left for making a mistake.](https://raw.githubusercontent.com/objetos15162/Play-It-/master/Proyecto/images/screenshot1.png)


If you'd like to see how this game is organised click here:
